property.name: rest.tmp.dir
property.description: Temporary directory on the local filesystem. Change this setting to point to a location more permanent than '/tmp' (The '/tmp' directory is often cleared on machine restart).

property.name: rest.local.dir
property.description: Directory on the local filesystem to be used as a local storage.

property.name: rest.server.info.bindAddress
property.description: The address for the Rest server web UI

property.name: rest.dns.interface
property.description: Rest uses the local host name for reporting its IP address. If your machine has multiple interfaces REST will use the interface that the primary host name resolves to. If this is insufficient, you can set this property to indicate the primary interface e.g., "eth1". This only works if your cluster configuration is consistent and every host has the same network interface configuration.

property.name: rest.zookeeper.dns.interface
property.description: The name of the Network Interface from which a ZooKeeper server should report its IP address.

property.name: rest.zookeeper.dns.nameserver
property.description: The host name or IP address of the name server (DNS) which a ZooKeeper server should use to determine the host name used by the master for communication and display purposes.

property.name: rest.server.versionfile.writeattempts
property.description: How many time to retry attempting to write a version file before just aborting. Each attempt is seperated by the rest.server.thread.wakefrequency milliseconds.

property.name: zookeeper.session.timeout
property.description: ZooKeeper session timeout. rest passes this to the zk quorum as suggested maximum time for a session (This setting becomes zookeeper's 'maxSessionTimeout'). See http://hadoop.apache.org/zookeeper/docs/current/zookeeperProgrammers.html#ch_zkSessions "The client sends a requested timeout, the server responds with the timeout that it can give the client. " In milliseconds.

property.name: zookeeper.znode.parent
property.description: Root Znode for rest in ZooKeeper. All of rest's ZooKeeper znodes that are configured with a relative path will go under this node. By default, all of rest's ZooKeeper file path are configured with a relative path, so they will all go under this directory unless changed.

property.name: rest.zookeeper.quorum
property.description: Comma separated list of servers in the ZooKeeper Quorum. For example, "host1.mydomain.com,host2.mydomain.com,host3.mydomain.com". By default this is set to localhost. For a fully-distributed setup, this should be set to a full list of ZooKeeper quorum servers. If REST_MANAGES_ZK is set in rest-env.sh this is the list of servers which we will start/stop ZooKeeper on.

property.name: rest.zookeeper.peerport
property.description: Port used by ZooKeeper peers to talk to each other. See http://hadoop.apache.org/zookeeper/docs/r3.1.1/zookeeperStarted.html#sc_RunningReplicatedZooKeeper for more information.

property.name: rest.zookeeper.leaderport
property.description: Port used by ZooKeeper for leader election. See http://hadoop.apache.org/zookeeper/docs/r3.1.1/zookeeperStarted.html#sc_RunningReplicatedZooKeeper for more information.

property.name: rest.zookeeper.useMulti
property.description: Instructs rest server to make use of ZooKeeper's multi-update functionality. This allows certain ZooKeeper operations to complete more quickly and prevents some issues with rare ZooKeeper failure scenarios (see the release note of HBASE-6710 for an example). IMPORTANT: only set this to true if all ZooKeeper servers in the cluster are on version 3.4+ and will not be downgraded. ZooKeeper versions before 3.4 do not support multi-update and will not fail gracefully if multi-update is invoked (see ZOOKEEPER-1495).

property.name: rest.zookeeper.property.initLimit
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. The number of ticks that the initial synchronization phase can take.

property.name: rest.zookeeper.property.syncLimit
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. The number of ticks that can pass between sending a request and getting an acknowledgment.

property.name: rest.zookeeper.property.dataDir
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. The directory where the snapshot is stored.

property.name: rest.zookeeper.property.clientPort
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. The port at which the clients will connect.

property.name: rest.zookeeper.property.maxClientCnxns
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. Limit on number of concurrent connections (at the socket level) that a single client, identified by IP address, may make to a single member of the ZooKeeper ensemble. Set high to avoid zk connection issues running standalone and pseudo-distributed.

property.name: rest.port
property.description: The http port for the REST server.

property.name: rest.https.port
property.description: The https port for the REST server.

property.name: rest.readonly
property.description: Defines the mode the REST server will be started in. Possible values are: false: All HTTP methods are permitted - GET/PUT/POST/DELETE. true: Only the GET method is permitted.

property.name: rest.threads.max
property.description: The maximum number of threads of the REST server thread pool. Threads in the pool are reused to process REST requests. This controls the maximum number of requests processed concurrently. It may help to control the memory used by the REST server to avoid out of memory issues. If the thread pool is full, incoming requests will be queued up and wait for some free threads. The default is 100.

property.name: rest.threads.min
property.description: The minimum number of threads of the REST server thread pool. The thread pool always has at least these number of threads so the REST server is ready to serve incoming requests. The default is 2.

property.name: rest.refresh.seconds
property.description: Time in seconds between refresh of the REST server page. Set to 0 to disable automatic refresh. The default is 5.
